title: Release 6.0 Hardware Testing
content:
Owned by Ross Philipson Last updated: Oct 02, 2016 by Ross Philipson

None

Copyright 2016 by Assured Information Security, Inc. Created by Ross Philipson <philipsonr@ainfosec.com>. This work is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International License. To view a copy of this license, visit http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/.

This page is to capture results from testing the 6.0 release on specific hardware platforms. Though OpenXT does not have an official HCL, the information here is a useful first step and helpful for people new to OpenXT. In general, for OpenXT to be fully functional, it currently needs to be run on an Intel vPro platform.

As 6.0 is tested on different hardware, please list the results in the table below. It would be impossible to have a column for every possible configuration, test or result; use the Notes column for extended information like this.

GEN - Intel CPU architecture generation: SNB (Sandy Bridge), IVB (Ivy Bridge), HSW (Haswell), BDW (Broadwell), SKL (Sky Lake)

FF - form factor: L (laptop), D (desktop), W (workstation), T (Tablet)

FW - firmware or BIOS version number

VER - OpenXT version

INST - successful install which also implies working networking/NDVM (all interfaces) and UIVM functionality

ML - successful measured launch (Y or N).  Also can reseal from a rootfs change (touch /test.txt) & BIOS configuration change

ML/S3 - successful sleep and resume with measured launch configured

UPG - successfully upgrade to 6.0.0 from 5.0.1

HVM (OS) - successfully installed, ran and installed tools in an HVM guest (note OS).

AUD - Successfully able to have audio playback & recording from within HVM guest.

ML/S3 - successful sleep and resume with measured launch configured

PT - successful PCI PT of GPU/USB controller on Desktop/Workstation model.


VendorModelGENFFFWVERINSTMLML/S3UPGHVM (OS)AUDNotes
